intro: Amyema nutans, commonly known as the nodding lily, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its drooping, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Amyema nutans thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
